alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Montgomery County; Clark; Garland; Hot Spring; Pike; Southwest Montgomery County Higher Elevations (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 16 at 8:20PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Clark, northern Pike, western Garland, southern Montgomery and west central Hot Spring Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 820 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Albert Pike Recreation Area, or 8 miles northeast of Umpire, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hot Springs... Hot Springs Village... Glenwood... Mountain Pine... Amity... Norman... Daisy... Hot Springs Memorial Field... Mimosa... Little Missouri Falls Recreatio... Daisy State Park... Meyers... Lake Ouachita State Park... Lofton... Rockwell... Hot Springs National Park... Albert Pike Recreation Area... Bismarck... Black Springs... Oaklawn Racetrack... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for southwestern Arkansas.

area.areaDesc: Central and Eastern Montgomery County; Clark; Garland; Hot Spring; Pike; Southwest Montgomery County Higher Elevations
